metadata.title: CVE-2022-2585 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high
metadata.description:
It was discovered that when exec'ing from a non-leader thread, armed POSIXCPU timers would be left on a list but freed, leading to a use-after-free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2585` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-46-generic - 5.15.0-46.49
linux-image-5.15.0-46-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-46.49
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-46-generic - 5.15.0-46.49
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-46-generic-64k - 5.15.0-46.49
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1016-kvm - 5.15.0-1016.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1017-aws - 5.15.0-1017.21
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required
